googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmNotes: Oregon is all vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Oregon driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Please provide your Oregon driver’s license number.  If you do not have one, please provide the last four digits of your social security number. If you do not have either of these numbers, write NONE on the form.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* All registered Oregon voters automatically receive vote-by-mail ballots. 
* You can still request a one-time absentee ballot if you need your ballot mailed someplace other than your usual address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Secretary of State  
Elections Division  
141 State Capitol  
Salem, OR 97310‐0722
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Oregon voters do not need to show ID.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmApplicationDirections:
* All Oregon elections are held by mail.  This means that Oregon will automatically send a mail-in ballot to every registered voter for the November 3, 2020 election.  
* If you need to update your mailing address **permanently**, [register to vote again](http://www.voteamerica.com/register-to-vote/) using your new mailing address. 
* If you need to update your mailing address **temporarily** -- because you will be out of town for the November 3, 2020 election --  [request a one-time absentee ballot](http://www.voteamerica.com/absentee-ballot/).
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: You must register with a party if you want to take part in that party’s primary election.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have an Oregon driver's license or state ID card.  If not, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Oregon voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Oregon you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Oregon
  * at least 16 years old (to vote, you must be 18 by Election Day)
